problem.question: When geographers look at the way places and things are laid out on the cultural landscape, they are taking a:

problem.question: Which of the following is not true regarding remote sensing?
problem.wrongAnswer: Involves Aircraft Reveals Environmental Changes None Of The Above

problem.question: What event markedly changed Chicago's relative location (which already had good centrality)?
problem.wrongAnswer: Opening Of The St. Lawrence Seaway

problem.question: A city is an example of what kind of region?

problem.rightAnswer: Asking Others How They Define The Region

problem.question: A country at the end of the demographic transition has which of the following?
problem.wrongAnswer: High Birth Rates And Low Death Rates A High Infant Mortality Rate A High Crude Birth Rate Low Birth And Death Rates High Population Density

The ability of a resource to sustain a population is known as its
During the last quarter of the twentieth century, the birth rate has fallen most significantly in which of the following countries?

problem.rightAnswer: Going To Work And Then Returning Home At The End Of The Day

problem.question: Which of the following refers to the study of the relationship between the physical environment and culture?
problem.wrongAnswer: Central Place Theory Ecosystem Analysis Culture History Cultural Ecology Polytheism

problem.question: Which of the following peoples can be described as a stateless nation?
Cultural convergence is sometimes called
What are the main features of a culture?

problem.rightAnswer: Culture Drawing On Multiple Influences Undermining Patriarchal Culture
problem.wrongAnswer: Eating A Big Mac In India None Of The Above

problem.question: Which of the following does NOT act as a centrifugal force for a state?
problem.wrongAnswer: Uneven development Substate nationalism Linguistic homogeneity A fragmented territorial base A strong tradition of local governance

problem.question: Which of the following best represents the concept of the nation-state in its internal cultural-political makeup and spatial organization?
Which of the following pairs of European countries has the greatest number of African colonies in 1914?
Political geographers consider which of the following as the core area of the United States?
Core-periphery models are generally based on the idea that...
problem.wrongAnswer: All world regions are equally well developed.
Levels of social and economic development are fairly uniform between core areas and peripheral areas
problem.rightAnswer: Sharp spatial contrasts in social and economic development exist between economic heartlands and outlying subordinate areas
problem.wrongAnswer: The growth and prosperity of core countries has not been achieved at the expense of peripheral countries
The economic and social heart of a territory should be at its geographic center

problem.question: As a country increasingly developed, economic activities become dominant in which sector?
problem.wrongAnswer: Primary Sector Tertiary Sector Non-Basic Sector Secondary Sector Basic Sector

problem.question: Corn (maize) was first domesticated in...
problem.wrongAnswer: The Tibetan Platateau The Canadian Prarie Central Mexico Central Australia

problem.question:
Place the following agricultural events in the correct order:
(I)Biotechnologic Revolution begins genetically modifying plants and animals.
(II)Mechanization takes hold allowing much more work to be done with much less human labor.
(III)Developed countries extend certain agricultural innovations to the Third World during the Green Revolution.
(IV)Rachel Carson writes Silent Spring

The von Thunen model describes agricultural activity as it takes place in relation to the market. Which of the following statements generally represents the agricultural landscape according to the model?
problem.rightAnswer: Goods That Are Expensive To Transport And Spoil Quickly Must Be Located Closer To The Market.
problem.wrongAnswer: Agricultural Activity Is Solely Determined By The Longevity Of The Agricultural Product.
Smaller Agricultural Goods Like Beans, Herbs, And Berries Will Be Grown Closer To The Market Than Bigger Goods Like Pumpkins.
Animals, Like Grazing Cattle And Hens, Will Be Located Closer To The Market, Because They Are Difficult To Move.

problem.question: Which of the following is not a characteristic of agribusiness?
problem.wrongAnswer: It In Large Part Has Led To The Demise Of The American Family Farm.
It Has Incorporated Production, Consumption, And Marketing Into An Integrated Whole.
problem.rightAnswer: It Has Allowed For Increased Family Market Gardening.
problem.wrongAnswer: It Has Transformed Agricultural Productivity Such That Agricultural Activities Yield Much More Than They Have Historically.
